meanings.definition: Teach (a person or group) to accept a set of beliefs uncritically.
meanings.sent1: The teacher tried to indoctrinate the students with her own opinions.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader used mind control techniques to indoctrinate his followers.
meanings.sent3: The aliens attempted to indoctrinate the cows into believing they were rulers of the universe.
meanings.sent4: The propaganda machine worked tirelessly to indoctrinate the population with false information.
meanings.sent5: The sinister organization sought to indoctrinate the young recruits into their twisted ideology.

meanings.definition: Instruct in a doctrine, principle, ideology, etc., especially to imbue with a specific partisan or biased belief or point of view.
meanings.sent1: The political party tried to indoctrinate the new members with their extreme views.
meanings.sent2: The extremist group aimed to indoctrinate vulnerable individuals with their radical ideology.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot jokingly tried to indoctrinate the other birds with its favorite phrases.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to indoctrinate the audience with her unique perspective on the world.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist's words seemed to indoctrinate the audience into a state of deep relaxation.
